posts.author: LauraMVX
posts.content:
I understand that Dragon builds took quite a hit in a late patch which increased the number of Druid/Shifter levels necessary to qualify for the feat. Kail Pendragon's famously elegant Cleric 25/Druid 14/Monk 1 'Order of Jormungandr' has the requested classes but is no longer legal.

Here is that build, for reference:
Spoiler Here's a dragon build which does not 25 cleric lvls to counter dispelling and toolset SR (together with SP feats of course), 14 druid lvls as the minimum to get dragon shape and 1 monk lvl for cheese, of course Actually the build started off as a CLC 26/ DR 14 but I couldn't resist the benefits that 1 single monk lvl would bring. Dragon shape at 33rd lvl already, you have to wait till 39th to get all the monk's boni though (that's to max out discipline and tumble, move it down if you feel you need the monk's boni earlier).Domains are what you feel suits you best, I chose trickery for II and travel for haste. I guess that's all, I'll let you judge the build:
PvM playable 1-40, untested PvP STR: 10 CON: 12 INT: 14 Skillpoints: 251 BAB: 25 AC (naked/mundane armor/shield only): 31/31 Stunning Fist: 1/day, DC 41

01: Druid(1): Expertise, Spell Penetration 03: Druid(3): Extend Spell 05: Druid(5) 07: Druid(7) 09: Cleric(1): Empower Spell,Domain: Travel, Trickery 11: Cleric(3) 13: Cleric(5) 15: Cleric(7): Knockdown 17: Cleric(9) 19: Cleric(11) 21: Cleric(13): Great Wisdom I, (WIS=24) 23: Cleric(15) 25: Cleric(17) 27: Cleric(19): Great Wisdom III, (WIS=27) 29: Druid(10) 31: Druid(12) 33: Druid(14): Dragon Shape 35: Cleric(21) 37: Cleric(23): Armor Skin 39: Monk(1): Epic Prowess,M:(Cleave,Evasion,IUS, St.F)



















Taking Druid to the requisite 18 levels would cut the Cleric levels down to 21, which would make it dispellable and also unable to penetrate toolset SR. Unfortunately!

You coud try inverting the split, and taking Cleric 15/Druid 24/Monk 1 - you get all your Cleric buffs (although they're dispellable), and you're a competent Druid, able to penetrate SR 30 with the penetration feats (wether or not thats enough will depend on where you play), and having a good DC due to high Wisdom. The only thing is I feel like the Druid doesn't synergize that well with the Dragon shape - go figure! - since they don't really use a lot of buffs (that's what the Cleric's for), and you can't cast your damaging/crowd control spells in Dragon form. But this way you might be able put down a Stonehold or Storm of Vengeance and then buff the dragon with your cleric spells, and mop up the defenseless enemies without worrying about being dispelled >:) (unless I'm missing something?)

One build in the archive actually takes this approach, 'the True Dragon Gleam', although its not as optimized as it could be. I'll try my hand at converting Order of Jormundgandr to this split, but I'm gonna warn you I haven't played a Druid at high levels yet, so I might miss some stuff. Hopefully it helps more than misleads!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
LauraMVX wrote: There is an experience penalty of 20% from level 39 to 40. This is to get a modified spellcraft level of 45, which requires taking Druid (or Cleric) at level 40.
Sorry if I'm being dumb here, but why the xp penalty? I thought humans didn't suffer from that.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Humans have favored class any, which means that when determining if a multiclass human suffers an XP penalty, his highest level class does not count (no matter what class).
Take away Druid and you have Cleric 15 Monk 1. It can happen even to humans when you have 3 base classes.

Now back to Krankui's build, with apologies...

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Lvl 28 (Druid) gives you another feat.

Lvl 24 (any caster) makes you impervious to dispels except from Mord's.

Improved Knockdown is not critical for the build because when you are in dragon form you already count as a huge-sized creature, so medium-sized opponents get (-8) to their discipline checks.

Improved expertise is usually not worth it I think, but considering your dragon is going to have something like 72 AB, maybe its worth it in this case, heheh. That said your AC will also be about 64, you might not need it. Maybe Called Shot to stop them from running away >:3

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
His AC will actually be a lot higher than that, this is not called the "king of all dragon builds" for nothing.

Doing a rough calculation we get something like: Base dragon form (41) +17 (wisdom, owl's insight) +5 (deflection, magic vestment) +5 (natural, bark-skin), +2 (armour skin), +8 (tumble), +2/4 (dexterity, cat's grace & aura of vitality) => 80/82 AC. And that's without using Expertise at all, or equipment for that matter. His AB will be 72 OR 70 when he uses his flurry of blows ability, giving him potentially up to 8 attacks with monk's progression.

Now, if your server does not have many creatures with high magic resistance (which i doubt) you can change all three feats of penetration to spell focus "conjuration", but personally i think you should keep them.
